explanation:
- OS_ObjectIndexFromToken: This is the direct callee used to translate the token to an index. It must be inspected for any string comparisons (e.g. using memcmp) when matching tokens.
- OS_OBJECT_TABLE_GET (macro/inline): The call in the target expands via this macro. The macro implementation may perform comparisons or call helper routines that could use memcmp on token contents.
- OS_impl_condvar_table (object table definition): The table layout and its lookup semantics determine how tokens are compared to table entries; the lookup code may use memcmp against stored names/IDs.
- OS_object_token_t (typedef/struct): The token layout (whether it contains a C string or byte array) is necessary to determine if any memcmp usage would be comparing null-terminated strings.
- OS_impl_condvar_internal_record_t (typedef/struct): Inspecting the record clarifies whether any fields (e.g. name strings) are involved in token/table comparisons performed during lookup.
- OS_Posix_CondVarReleaseMutex: The cleanup handler pushed around pthread_cond_wait could call code that does string comparisons; include to ensure no hidden memcmp usage in the cancellation-path helper.
- memcmp (standard library): Include the symbol so the analyzer can directly check uses of memcmp in the above symbols/implementations to determine whether it is used to compare null-terminated strings.
